word.entryDescription: a large area where people live and work
word.entryExample: A town is smaller than a city.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a box you keep toys in
word.entryExample: What's in your toybox?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a prepared or marked surface on which racing takes place
word.entryExample: My brother is running on track 1.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: leisure or sports shoes
word.entryExample: You need good trainers when you go for a run.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a collection of very valuable things, or one thing of great value
word.entryExample: The treasure is somewhere on this island.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a game in which the players try and find something hidden by reading short messages
word.entryExample: Sam and his friends had a treasure hunt.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a tall plant with leaves and a wooden trunk and branches
word.entryExample: There's an apple tree in my garden.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a piece of clothing that covers your legs and lower half of your body
word.entryExample: These are my favourite trousers.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a truck is the same as a lorry especially in American English
word.entryExample: He plays with toy cars and trucks.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an elephant's long soft nose, which it can use to hold things
word.entryExample: The elephant moved its trunk to smell the flowers.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the day after Monday
word.entryExample: My piano lesson is on Tuesday.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the number 12
word.entryExample: I always eat my lunch at twelve.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the number 20
word.entryExample: It takes twenty minutes to get here by train.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the number 2
word.entryExample: She has two sisters.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: not nice to look at
word.entryExample: The monster is very ugly!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a thing you hold over your head to protect yourself from the rain
word.entryExample: Take an umbrella in case it rains.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: your mother or father's brother, or their sister's husband
word.entryExample: My uncle always remembers to send me a birthday card.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: directly below or at a lower level than something
word.entryExample: There's a mat on the floor, under the table.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a railway system in which electric trains travel below the ground in a city
word.entryExample: I like travelling by underground, because it's very quick.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: towards a higher place
word.entryExample: The bird is flying up to the top of the tree.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: towards or in a higher part of the building
word.entryExample: Go upstairs to bed.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: in the way that most often happens
word.entryExample: My cat usually sleeps in our library.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: plants, roots or seeds, that are used as food, especially in dishes that are not sweet
word.entryExample: I eat a lot of vegetables for lunch because they're healthy.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to a great degree
word.entryExample: A crocodile has got a very big teeth and a very long tail.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: used to make a verb stronger
word.entryExample: I don't like this room very much, can I have a different room?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: somebody who treats sick and injured animals
word.entryExample: My sister wants to be a vet.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small area where people live in the countryside
word.entryExample: I like living in my village.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to stop sleeping
word.entryExample: Do you usually wake up early?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to move forward by repeatedly putting one foot in front of the other
word.entryExample: I walk to school, I don't take the bus.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the vertical flat surface at the side of a room
word.entryExample: The walls in my bedroom are white.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: having a pleasant temperature but not hot
word.entryExample: It's very warm today, so let's go for a walk.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to clean something wth soap and water
word.entryExample: I need to wash my clothes, they're dirty.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to look at and enjoy something like television or sport
word.entryExample: I watch TV in the evenings.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a clear liquid with no colour or taste that you need to drink
word.entryExample: Can I have a glass of water?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a place where a river or stream drops suddenly from higher to lower ground
word.entryExample: Next to the mountain there is a beautiful waterfall.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a very big round fruit with a thick green skin and juicy pink flesh
word.entryExample: I love to eat watermelon in the summer.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: not strong
word.entryExample: I'm not very strong, I'm weak.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to have clothes on your body
word.entryExample: What does she usually wear?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the conditions that exist in the air like the temperature, rain, snow, sun etc
word.entryExample: We can't leave now, because the weather is very windy.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the day after Tuesday
word.entryExample: Wednesday is in the middle of the week.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: Saturday and Sunday
word.entryExample: I often go swimming at the weekend.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to greet someone in a polite and friendly way in a specific place
word.entryExample: Welcome to my new house, come in!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: in a good way
word.entryExample: I can speak English very well.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the direction towards which the sun sets in the evening
word.entryExample: It rains a lot in the west
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: rainy, or covered in water
word.entryExample: Oh no, my clothes are all wet!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a very large sea mammal that looks like a fish and breathes through a hole on the top of its head
word.entryExample: The whale is the biggest animal in the world.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: one of the round things under a vehicle that turn and make it moves
word.entryExample: My bike needs new wheels.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something that is white is the colour of snow
word.entryExample: My cat is black and white.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: having a large distance from one side to the other
word.entryExample: The river is very wide.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a female partner in a marriage
word.entryExample: The king talked about his wife, the queen, during our visit.
word.label: ydp
